nodes.name: Factory
deploy

nodes.documentation:
@dev Changes the bootstrapper address. Only authorized addresses can call.
@param _bootstrapperAddr The new bootstrapper address
nodes.name: setBootstrapper
findBootstrapper
Factory
deploy

nodes.documentation:
@dev Changes the bootstrapper address. Only authorized addresses can call.
@param _bootstrapperAddr The new bootstrapper address
nodes.name: setBootstrapper
findBootstrapper

params._bootstrapperAddr: Address of the bootstrapper contract that holds the desired runtime code for deployed contracts

deploy(bytes32).details: Deploys a contract with CREATE2 using initCode and the supplied salt. Can only be called by authorized entities

params._salt: The salt that determines the deployed contract address

deploy(bytes32).return: The address of the deployed contract

findBootstrapper().details: Returns the bootstraper address. This function is redundant, but it's function signature is hardocded into the deployer bytecode, and it is kept to avoid bugs should the name of the bootstrapperAddr change.
findBootstrapper().return: The address of the bootstrapper contract

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check performed by calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. If no Guard instance is configured, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call.

setBootstrapper(address).details: Changes the bootstrapper address. Only authorized addresses can call.

params._guard: The address of the new Guard instance.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.

userdoc.notice: A CREATE2 contract factory. Specifically intended to deploy contracts with indeterminate init code. Deployment pattern based on ideas from https://blog.ricmoo.com/wisps-the-magical-world-of-create2-5c2177027604
